availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Hall (Washington County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Noe. Father of Frank Hall, J. M. Hall, Nancy Hall, Sally Hall, and Paulina Hall. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Served in the Kentucky militia as a lieutenant colonel. Killed by guerrillas in Washington County.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 2, p. 54.
Thirteenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1910), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 3, p. 12B.
Fourteenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1920), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Mackville, p. 1A.
William L Myers and Albert E Cochran, “Trial of One-Armed Berry, The Guerrilla: Second Day's Proceedings,” The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 17, 1866, p. 1.
Kentucky, Death Records, 1852-1964, Film 7019803, Washington County, February 4, 1934 (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
KYR-0002-225-0060.
